intro: Halosarcia leptoclada, commonly known as the slender bladder bladder, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive bladder-like structures called calyces. The plant is native to South America and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with tendrils that aid in climbing. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
